data.title: Bush second team all-state
data.meta_description: East Texas News -The news portal - latest breaking news available online!
data.text:
Livingston’s successful baseball team earned a final accolade this week, as one of its college-bound athletes was named to the Texas Sports Writers Association All-State team.

Copeland Bush, who in late June earned third-team honors on the Texas High School Baseball Coaches Association team, was selected to the second team in the statewide vote of writers. The Arlington Baptist signee finished the season with a .435 batting average.

The Lions were area finalists after dropping a pair of games to state-ranked Spring Hill, which placed five players on the all-state team.

Texarkana Liberty-Eylau’s W.T. Jones was voted as the Class 4A player of the year. Jones held a 10-2 record on the mound with a 1.51 earned run average in 60 innings with 47 strikeouts. The senior, who also played shortstop, batted .396 with 41 runs batted and 26 runs batted in to lead the 33-9-1 Leopards to their second state title. The other came in 2006.

BLUE BELL/TSWA CLASS 4A ALL-STATE BASEBALL First team Pitchers: Collier Carroll, Calallen, soph.; Landon Bartell, Spring Hill, jr.; Cade Segura, Pleasanton, jr.

Reliever: Zach Blum, Decatur, sr.

Catcher: Tristian Garcia, Port Isabel, sr.
